Interface Shape

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Shape>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Circle, ComposedShape, Polygon, PolygonDyn, PolygonVect, Rectangle, Triangle
    public interface Shape
extends java.lang.Comparable<Shape>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double area()
      Gets the area of the shape.
      int compareTo​(Shape other)
      Compares this shape with the specified object with respect to their areas.
      void decrement()
      Decrements the shape positions by 1.0 in both (x,y) plane.
      void draw​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Takes a Graphics object as parameter and draws the shape.
      void increment()
      Increments the shape positions by 1.0 in both (x,y) plane.
      double perimeter()
      Gets the perimeter of the shape.

    • Method Detail

      • area

        double area()
        Gets the area of the shape.
        Returns:
        Area of the shape.

      • perimeter

        double perimeter()
        Gets the perimeter of the shape.
        Returns:
        Perimeter of the shape.

      • compareTo

        int compareTo​(Shape other)
        Compares this shape with the specified object with respect to their areas.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Shape>
        Parameters:
        The - shape to be compared.
        Returns:
        A negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object's area is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.

      • increment

        void increment()
        Increments the shape positions by 1.0 in both (x,y) plane.

      • decrement

        void decrement()
        Decrements the shape positions by 1.0 in both (x,y) plane.

      • draw

        void draw​(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Takes a Graphics object as parameter and draws the shape. This method will be called from the paintComponent method of a JPanel object.
        Parameters:
        Graphics - object to draw into.
        See Also:
        JPanel, Graphics
